title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power secured approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage system at the former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
The facility will include two substations and 816 lithium-ion battery enclosures, connecting to Eversource's Mystic Substation.
The storage system is part of the broader 'Docklands' project, set to include lab, retail, and 3,200 residential units.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on February 28, 2026, with Mumford & Sons as the musical guest.
Storrie was joined by 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams, featuring in a skating-centric sketch together.
US Olympic hockey team members, including Megan Keller and Hilary Knight, appeared during Storrie's monologue.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls at Sports Illustrated Stadium.
Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana returned to the Revolution's lineup, strengthening their defense after a previous loss.
Despite improved defense, New England struggled with the Red Bulls' press and missed key scoring opportunities.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready for MLB action by Opening Day due to a torn patellar tendon.
Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval threw live batting practice and hope to be available by Opening Day.
Red Sox have no clear roles for Casas, Crawford, and Sandoval due to offseason moves and team lineup changes.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce laws against illegal passing by drivers.
The cameras activate when stop signs are extended, capturing violations, and issuing citations without police presence.
A recent pilot in Peabody showed over 3,400 violations in 8 months, highlighting the prevalence of illegal passes.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed a sold-out two-hour show at Mohegan Sun Arena with his eight-piece band.
Stapleton's setlist included hits like 'Tennessee Whiskey,' 'Arkansas,' and 'Joy of My Life'.
The concert featured intimate stripped-down moments and legendary band members like pedal steel player Paul Franklin.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs's potential release could save the Patriots $16.8 million due to a unique contract structure.
Garrett Bradbury and Morgan Moses might both face cuts depending on competition and free agency plans.
Christian Elliss, amidst roster revamp, may be released to free up cap space despite the Patriots' linebacker depth concerns.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in the Celtics' game against the 76ers as he recovers from an Achilles injury.
Philadelphia 76ers' center Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game due to an oblique strain.
The Celtics have won eight of their last ten games and are ranked second in the Eastern Conference standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hits two home runs against Twins in Red Sox' spring training game.
Duran, typically weak against lefties, shows strong performance with three homers in spring training.
Red Sox may reconsider lineup plans due to Duran's impressive start, with potential as designated hitter.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals at Boston College this season.
Seven Bruins draftees played in the BC-BU hockey match, where BU won 3-1 despite Letourneau's goal.
Boston Bruins' prospect Hagens, drafted 7th in 2025, has 39 points in 29 games this season at BC.
